intro: Ferula ruthenica, commonly known as the Caucasian cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ferula ruthenica is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
